intro: Betonica rosea, commonly known as rosemary betonica, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has aromatic leaves that are often used in herbal remedies and traditional medicine. Betonica rosea is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
